1.text: Call now, if there is any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?

2.text: For wrath killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the silly one.

3.text: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.

4.text: His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.

5.text: Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.

6.text: Although affliction cometh not forth from the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;

7.text: Yet man is born to trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

8.text: I would seek to God, and to God would I commit my cause:

9.text: Who doeth great things and unsearchable; wonderful things without number:

10.text: Who giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields:

11.text: To set on high those that are low: that those who mourn may be exalted to safety.

12.text: He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.

13.text: He taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.

14.text: They meet with darkness in the day-time, and grope in the noon-day as in the night.

15.text: But he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.

16.text: So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.

17.text: Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:

18.text: For he maketh sore, and bindeth up: he woundeth, and his hands make whole.

19.text: He will deliver thee in six troubles: yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.

20.text: In famine he will redeem thee from death: and in war from the power of the sword.

21.text: Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue: neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.

22.text: At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.

23.text: For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field: and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.

24.text: And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle will be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.

25.text: Thou shalt know also that thy seed will be great, and thy offspring as the grass of the earth.

26.text: Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age, as a shock of corn cometh in in its season.

27.text: Lo this, we have searched it, so it is; hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
